conbody.p: An image is the basis for instances that you spin up for your computing needs. If you have access to images that meet your needs, you can skip this section. This section explains how to add an image to your Eucalyptus cloud that is customized for your needs.
There are a few ways you can add an image to Eucalyptus:

ul.li: Add an image based on an existing image. If you have an image already, read the rest of this section.
Add an image that you modify from an existing image. If you have an image that you want to modify, see .
Add an image that you create from scratch. If you want to create an image from scratch, see .

conbody.p: Each of these three ways has a different first step, but the way you get image to Eucalyptus is the same. To enable an image as an executable entity, you do the following:

ol.li: Bundle a root disk image and kernel/ramdisk pair
Upload the bundled image to Walrus bucket storage

conbody.note: Note that while all users can bundle, upload and register images, only the administrator has the required permissions to upload and register kernels and ramdisks.
